conbody.p: The Thesaurus view can be activated by clicking the "Thesaurus" icon in the Toolbar. Thesaurus compiles a controlled vocabulary, which is used for the metadata of the database objects like date, location, provenance, bibliographical references, etc. All terms of a thesaurus reflect a semantic network of concepts including relationships between synonyms, broader and narrower (parent/child) contexts, and other related concepts. Thesaurus entries are offered in the Passport Editor window of the Text Editor and of the Lemma Editor and serve to select the metadata for Text Corpus Object, Texts or Lemma entries. New entries can be added here as well. Any user can see the contents of the Thesaurus view, but the right to create or modify them is restricted by the relevant user role.

NOTE: This chapter provides a general description of the Workspace with its windows and tabs of the Thesaurus View. For a step-by-step instruction of how to enter or edit a new Thesaurus entry please refer to the relevant chapter in the User Guide section of this manual ().
If a Thesaurus entry you need is missing, please send a proposal to the BTS team in Berlin via E-mail: aegypt1@bbaw.de.
The three windows from left to right are: Thesaurus Navigator, Passport Data Editor, Annotations.
